column4: Who can help me? When I press Ctrl+c in terminal (to stop some programms) nothing happends. It just prints letter "c" but not "^C" Earlier it works correctly. (Sorry. I know English very very bad)
depends on the program, sometimes you need to ctrl+d
for example find
Ctrl+d not works too
not sure what the problem is, ctrl+c should work fine with find
can shotructs in compiz be a problem?
did you recently configure new ones before ctrl+c stopped working in the terminal?
maybe
this is in gnome-terminal right?
yes
try resetting your keyboard to defaults in System/Preferences/Keyboard on the Layouts tab
nothing changes
in the keyboard layout options of System/Preferences/Keyboard on the layout tab, is the ctrl key position set to default?
yes :(
switching off comiz is not a solution too
does ctrl+ anything work? can you copy and paste with ctrl+shift+c ctrl+shift+v?
1) no, I can't copy from terminal using ctrl+c 2) that's interesting: when I push ctrl+c it prints russian letters

interesting, I saw that in a bug report http://forum.soft32.com/linux/Bug-513261-gnome-terminal-Ctrl-modifier-work-ftopict475450.html but a later message said he reset his keyboard to defaults in the gnome keyboard properties and it was fixed, which is why I suggested that earlier, but didn't seem to help
I will restart my computer
AAAAAAAAAA!!! It works!!! Thank you very much!
excellent!
good night (there is GMT+2)
